description: This notification is sent when a new Alarm is
generated and stored in the Active Alarm Table.
Note that the notification does not include all
objects for the corresponding entry in the Alarm
Table. The reason is that some environments may have
problems with large PDUs. Thus, the notification
receiver must get the missing objects from the
Active Alarm Table.
The value 'cleared' for the PerceivedSeverity
is not allowed for an alarm notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmNew ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmEventTime s EXAMPLEE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::sendNotificationId i 9999 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::lastSendNotificationId i 9999 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::systemDN s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmCode s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmManagedObjectInstance s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmEventType i 1 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmProbableCause i 0 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmPerceivedSeverity i 1 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmSpecificProblem s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmAdditionalText s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmNetype s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmIndex i 9999 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmId s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmCodeName s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmManagedObjectInstanceName s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmSystemType s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmNeIP s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmAck i 1 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::cleiCode s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::timeZoneID s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::timeZoneOffset i 9999 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::dSTSaving i 9999 ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::aid s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::id s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmMocObjectInstance s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmComment s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmOtherInfo s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the event time of the subject alarm.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmEventTime

description: This object represent the notification identifier
of current send notification ( AlarmNew,AlarmCleared,AlarmAckChange,AlarmCommentChange,AlarmSync)
The agent shall store the notification identifier
of the last send FM notification in this object
immediately after sending the notification.
The manager can retrieve the current value of this
object to detect lost notifications. This mechanism
can be used by the manager when no notification
is received for a certain time (e.g. 10 minutes)
to evaluate whether a synchronization should be performed.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::sendNotificationId

description: This object represent the notification identifier
of last send notification ( AlarmNew, AlarmCleared,AlarmAckChange,AlarmCommentChange)

object to detect lost notifications. This mechanism
can be used by the manager when no notification
is received for a certain time (e.g. 10 minutes)
to evaluate whether a synchronization should be performed.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::lastSendNotificationId

description: This object carries the Distinguished Name (DN) of the system
which generates the Notification.
The combination of notificationId and systemDN uniquely
identifies each notification.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::systemDN

description: This object represents an alarm code
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmCode

description: This object identifies the MO instance of
network resource to which the alarm is
related.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmManagedObjectInstance

description: This object represents the type of event.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmEventType

description: This object represents the probable cause
of the current.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmProbableCause

description: This object represents the perceived severity of
the alarm.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmPerceivedSeverity

description: This object represents the vendor specific problem
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmSpecificProblem

description: This object represents some arbitrary additional
information of the alarm.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmAdditionalText

description: This object represents an alarm netype
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmNetype

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the
Active Alarm Table. It increases every time a new alarm
occurs. Due to cleared alarms the index will not be
contiguous. When the maximum is reached of
Integer32, the value of this object rolls over to 1.
The actor must use 'alarmEventTime' to sort on
chronological order.
The alarmIndex object is read-only ,and it
is used as index in the Active Alarm Table.
The alarmIndex facilities the way to extract
the corresponding value from a notification where
the object is included.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmIndex

variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmComment

description: This object represents the custom properity of the alarm.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmOtherInfo

description: This notification is generated when an alarm is
cleared. A cleared alarm is removed from the
Active Alarm Table and is no longer accessible.
It's impossible to retrieve an cleared alarm from
Active Alarm Table any more.

description: This object represents the event time of the subject alarm.

description: This object represent the notification identifier
of current send notification ( AlarmNew,AlarmCleared,AlarmAckChange,AlarmCommentChange,AlarmSync)
The agent shall store the notification identifier
of the last send FM notification in this object
immediately after sending the notification.
The manager can retrieve the current value of this
object to detect lost notifications. This mechanism
can be used by the manager when no notification
is received for a certain time (e.g. 10 minutes)
to evaluate whether a synchronization should be performed.

description: This object represent the notification identifier

description: This object uniquely identifies an entry in the
Active Alarm Table. It increases every time a new alarm
occurs. Due to cleared alarms the index will not be
contiguous. When the maximum is reached of
Integer32, the value of this object rolls over to 1.
The actor must use 'alarmEventTime' to sort on
chronological order.
The alarmIndex object is read-only ,and it
is used as index in the Active Alarm Table.
The alarmIndex facilities the way to extract
the corresponding value from a notification where
the object is included.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmSyncStart ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::systemDN s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::syncUniqueId i 9999

description: This object carries the Distinguished Name (DN) of the system
which generates the Notification.
The combination of notificationId and systemDN uniquely
identifies each notification.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::systemDN

description: This object represent the sync identifier of the same alarm sync operation.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::syncUniqueId

description: This notification is sent after send all alarmSync trap to nms.

event.Summary: All alarmSync (syncId: $v2) trap sent to NMS

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::alarmSyncEnd ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::systemDN s EXAMPLE ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::syncUniqueId i 9999

description: This object carries the Distinguished Name (DN) of the system
which generates the Notification.
The combination of notificationId and systemDN uniquely
identifies each notification.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::systemDN

description: This object represent the sync identifier of the same alarm sync operation.
variables.name: ZTE-ALARM-IRP-MIB::syncUniqueId
